about.title: Who am I?
about.content: I am an Assistant Professor of Astrostatistics jointly appointed between the Department of Statistical Sciences and the David A. Dunlap Department of Astronomy & Astrophysics at the University of Toronto. I am also an Associate Member of the Dunlap Institute for Astronomy & Astrophysics as well as a Member of the Data Sciences Institute.

highlightBox.title: A Few Other Things
highlightBox.content: I also teach both undergraduate and graduate courses in statistics and astronomy, serve on a few committees (both within the University of Toronto and some professional societies such as the AAS, ASA-AIG, and SSC-DSA), and help manage the Astronomy & Astrophysics Summer Undergraduate Research Program (SURP) (the largest of its kind in Canada!).

team.content: I am incredibly fortunate to co-lead the interdisciplinary Astrostatistics Research Team (ART) along with its founder Gwen Eadie.

highlights.title: Cutting-Edge, Interdisciplinary Research
highlights.content: Pioneering new methods in astrophysics at the intersection of statistics and AI

highlights.title: Collaborative, Inclusive Environment
highlights.content: Interdisciplinary team spanning astrophysics, statistics, and data science

research.title: What do I do?
research.intro: My research focuses on four main areas:

areas.title: Statistical Learning & AI
areas.description: Developing novel methods to discover underlying patterns from (many) large, messy datasets.

areas.title: Interpretability & Insight
areas.description: Building up a rigorous understanding of how statistical methods work both in theory and in practice in order to extract novel scientific insights.

areas.title: Inference & Computation
areas.description: Establishing robust frameworks and designing tractable algorithms to efficiently quantify how much we can learn from data.

areas.title: Discovery & Understanding
areas.description: Applying these methods to large-scale astronomical surveys to uncover new insights about the universe, with a focus on how galaxies like our own Milky Way form, behave, and evolve over time.

research.additionalContent: This work often involves working with massive datasets from wide-field imaging and spectroscopic surveys containing observations ranging from billions of stars and galaxies to interstellar gas and dust, but can also include smaller datasets from targeted observations of individual objects along with everything in between.

collaboration.title: Collaboration & Mentorship
collaboration.intro: I consider collaboration and mentorship to be at the heart of my research and love working with students, postdocs, visiting researchers, and faculty across disciplines. If you're interested in working with me on a short-term or long-term project, please don't hesitate to reach out.

items.title: Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion
items.content: We strive to create an environment where diverse backgrounds are an integral and well-supported part of our research community as well as individual members' identities as researchers. All members should know they are always valued.

items.title: Open and Accessible Science
items.content: We're committed to growing our community by engaging in reproducible research, releasing open-source tools and pedagogical materials, and mentoring the next generation of astrostatisticians and data scientists through hands-on learning.

categories.title: Postdoctoral Researchers
categories.content: Gwen and I are always looking for enthusiastic postdoctoral researchers to join the Astrostatistics Research Team! If you are interested in applying your skills to cutting-edge research in astrostatistics, please feel free to reach out to either me and/or Gwen.

categories.title: Graduate Students
categories.content: I am always looking for enthusiastic students to join our research group. While I cannot directly admit graduate students, I encourage applications to our Master's/Doctoral programs. Please feel free to reach out if you are interested in learning more about my research and how it might fit into your potential graduate studies.

categories.title: Undergraduate Students
categories.content: I love working with undergraduate students both throughout the year and over the summer. I often post opportunities through existing program streams (to ensure equitable review processes), so please keep an eye on some of the opportunities outlined below. If you are interested in learning more, please feel free to reach out.

categories.title: Visiting Researchers & External Collaborators
categories.content: I am always happy to start up new collaborations or strengthen existing ones. If you are interested in coming to the University of Toronto for either a short visit or extended stay, please reach out so we can discuss potential projects and coordinate funding.

biography.title: Short Biography

timeline.title: Childhood
timeline.content: Shuttled between the US (around Milwaukee) and China (Beijing and Shanghai). Fell in love with astronomy at age 17 after reading From Eternity to Here by Sean Carroll.

timeline.title: Undergraduate
timeline.content: Bachelor's Degree with Honors in Astrophysics and Physics at Harvard University. Participated in multiple research projects across astronomy.

timeline.title: Research Fellow
timeline.content: Worked with Alexie Leauthaud and Kevin Bundy at Kavli IPMU. Began shifting my focus to astrostatistics and data science.

timeline.title: Graduate School
timeline.content: Master's and Doctoral Degrees at Harvard. Thesis: "Mapping the Milky Way in the Age of Gaia" under Doug Finkbeiner, Charlie Conroy, and Daniel Eisenstein, with additional supervision by Alyssa Goodman.

timeline.title: Postdoctoral Fellow
timeline.content: Banting Fellow and Dunlap Fellow at University of Toronto, working with Gwen Eadie.

timeline.title: Assistant Professor
timeline.content: Joint appointment in Statistical Sciences and Astronomy & Astrophysics. Co-leading the Astrostatistics Research Team (ART) with Gwen Eadie.

timeline.title: Research Scientist
timeline.content: While on leave from UofT, worked as a Research Scientist at River Run Trading on cutting-edge quantitative trading strategies for crypto assets.

biography.personalNote: Outside of work, I mostly enjoy hanging out at home or going out with my wife, our two dogs, and our son. I also watch way too much anime, play way too many video games, and have a supremely unhealthy love of junk food and soda.
